Package com.jesusnut.reports.extentreports

Class ExtentReport

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jesusnut.reports.extentreports.ExtentReport
  • public final class ExtentReport
extends java.lang.Object
    Perform initialisation and termination of ExtentReports.
    After creating an instance for ExtentTest, it is delegated to ThreadLocal variable for providing thread safety.
    Contains utlity methods for ExtentTest
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Abhishek Bhardwaj-JesusNut
    See Also:
    ExtentSparkReporter, ExtentLogger, ExtentManager, ExtentReportListener, ExtentReportHelper

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void assignAuthor​(Author author)
      Logs the author details in the authors view in the extent report.
      static void assignCategory​(Category[] category)
      Logs the category/categories to which a test case/test method belongs to.
      static void createTest​(java.lang.String testCaseName, java.lang.String description)
      Creates a test node in the extent report.
      Delegates to ExtentManager.setExtentTest(ExtentTest) for providing thread safety.
      static void flushReports()
      Flushing the reports ensures extent logs are reflected properly.
      Opens the report in the default desktop browser.
      Sets the threadlocal (with Extent Test instance) to default value in ExtentManager.unloadTest() on completion of test node.
      private static java.util.Date getTime​(long millis)
      Returns a Date object representing this Calendar's time value.
      static void initReports()
      Sets the initial configuration for Extent Reporting.
      Responsible for customizing the extent report.
      static void setEndTime​(long time)
      Logs the end time of execution of a test case/test method.
      static void setStartTime​(long time)
      Logs the start time of execution of a test case/test method.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • initReports

        public static void initReports()
        Sets the initial configuration for Extent Reporting.
        Responsible for customizing the extent report.

      • flushReports

        public static void flushReports()
        Flushing the reports ensures extent logs are reflected properly.
        Opens the report in the default desktop browser.
        Sets the threadlocal (with Extent Test instance) to default value in ExtentManager.unloadTest() on completion of test node.

      • createTest

        public static void createTest​(java.lang.String testCaseName,
                              java.lang.String description)
        Creates a test node in the extent report.
        Delegates to ExtentManager.setExtentTest(ExtentTest) for providing thread safety.
        Parameters:
        testCaseName - - name of test case in String format
        description - - description of test case in String format

      • assignAuthor

        public static void assignAuthor​(Author author)
        Logs the author details in the authors view in the extent report. 
          NOTE : Only a single author can be assigned to a test case/test method in JesusNut Framework.
        Parameters:
        author - - Author from Author who authored the test case

      • assignCategory

        public static void assignCategory​(Category[] category)
        Logs the category/categories to which a test case/test method belongs to.
        Parameters:
        category - - Categories from Category to which a test case /test method belong.

      • setStartTime

        public static void setStartTime​(long time)
        Logs the start time of execution of a test case/test method.
        Parameters:
        time - - time in long format

      • setEndTime

        public static void setEndTime​(long time)
        Logs the end time of execution of a test case/test method.
        Parameters:
        time - - time in long format

      • getTime

        private static java.util.Date getTime​(long millis)
        Returns a Date object representing this Calendar's time value.
        Parameters:
        millis - - time in long format
        Returns:
        java.util.Date
